tool.name: SAGA.grid_analysis.0
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEST_POINTS False isArrayDEST_GRID False isArrayCOST False isArrayDIR_MAXCOST False output_data_ACCUMULATED $output_data_ACCUMULATED output_data_ALLOCATION $output_data_ALLOCATION name SAGA.grid_analysis.0 DEST_TYPE $DEST_TYPE DEST_POINTS $DEST_POINTS DEST_GRID $DEST_GRID COST $COST DIR_MAXCOST $DIR_MAXCOST DIR_UNIT $DIR_UNIT DIR_K $DIR_K THRESHOLD $THRESHOLD prefer $prefer response $response outputType_ACCUMULATED $OutputSection_ACCUMULATED.outputType_ACCUMULATED transmissionMode_ACCUMULATED $OutputSection_ACCUMULATED.transmissionMode_ACCUMULATED outputType_ALLOCATION $OutputSection_ALLOCATION.outputType_ALLOCATION transmissionMode_ALLOCATION $OutputSection_ALLOCATION.transmissionMode_ALLOCATION

param.name: DEST_POINTS
param.label: Destinations
param.help: Destinations The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json

param.name: DEST_GRID
param.label: Destinations
param.help: Destinations The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: COST
param.label: Local Cost
param.help: Local Cost The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: DIR_MAXCOST
param.label: Direction of Maximum Cost
param.help: Direction of Maximum Cost The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: DIR_K
param.label: K Factor
param.help: effective friction = stated friction ^f , where f = cos(DifAngle)^k.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_ACCUMULATED
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_ALLOCATION
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Calculation of accumulated cost, either isotropic or anisotropic, if direction of maximum cost is specified.
